title: peterk87/nf-virontus pipeline parameters
description: Nextflow workflow for Nanopore sequence analysis of viruses

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.help_text: You will need to create a samplesheet with information about the samples you would like to analyse before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a table with 2 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://github.com/peterk87/nf-virontus/blob/master/docs/usage.md).
input.description: Path to CSV, TSV, Excel XLSX or LibreOffice ODS file containing information about the samples you would like to analyse.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.

save_cat_reads.description: Option whether or not to save the concatenated reads FASTQ file for each sample to the output directory.

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Options for the reference genome indices used to align reads.

genome.help_text: Only reference genomes specified in Nextflow configuration files are valid input.

fasta.help_text: If you have no genome reference available, the pipeline can build one using a FASTA file. This requires additional time and resources, so it's better to use a pre-build index if possible.

gff.description: Full path to GFF annotation file.

primer_bed.description: A BED file containing primer coordinates. iVar is used to trim primer sequences after read alignment and before variant calling.
primer_bed.help_text:
iVar uses the primer positions relative to the viral genome supplied in this file to soft clip primer sequences from a coordinate sorted BAM file. The file must be in BED format as highlighted below:

```
MN908947.3 30 54 nCoV-2019_1_LEFT 60 -
MN908947.3 385 410 nCoV-2019_1_RIGHT 60 +
MN908947.3 320 342 nCoV-2019_2_LEFT 60 -
MN908947.3 704 726 nCoV-2019_2_RIGHT 60 +
```

save_reference.description: If generated by the pipeline save reference genome related files to the results folder.

sars_cov_2_analysis_options.title: SARS-CoV-2 Analysis Options
sars_cov_2_analysis_options.description: SARS-CoV-2 specific analysis options and convenience flags.

artic_v3.description: Convenience flag for setting [ARTIC V3 primer BED file](https://github.com/artic-network/artic-ncov2019/blob/master/primer_schemes/nCoV-2019/V3/nCoV-2019.bed) for primer trimming.

freed.description: Convenience flag for setting 1200bp [Freed et al (2020)](https://academic.oup.com/biomethods/article/5/1/bpaa014/5873518) [primer BED file](https://zenodo.org/record/3897530) for primer trimming.

variant_calling_options.title: Variant calling options
variant_calling_options.description: Various options for the variant calling branch of the pipeline.

ivar_trim_noprimer.description: This option unsets the '-e' parameter in 'ivar trim' to discard reads without primers. See [iVar docs for more info](https://andersen-lab.github.io/ivar/html/manualpage.html#autotoc_md16)

major_allele_fraction.description: Major variant allele frequency/fraction. Only major variant alleles are used for generating a consensus sequence.

low_coverage.description: Low coverage depth threshold. Consensus sequence positions with less than this coverage depth will be masked with `N`.

phylogenetic_analysis_options.title: Phylogenetic Analysis Options
phylogenetic_analysis_options.description: Options for performing phylogenetic analysis with [MAFFT](https://mafft.cbrc.jp/alignment/software/) multiple sequence alignment (MSA) of consensus sequences (and optional user-specified sequences) and [IQ-TREE](http://www.iqtree.org/) maximum-likelihood phylogenetic tree inference. Tree visualization will be output in MultiQC report.

tree.description: Generate [IQ-TREE](http://www.iqtree.org/) phylogenetic tree from consensus sequences (and user-specified sequences).

tree_extra_fasta.description: Optional sequences to include in phylogenetic tree construction along with consensus sequences generated from raw input sequence data.

kraken2_options.title: Kraken2 analysis options
kraken2_options.description: Options for [Kraken2](https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/kraken2/) taxonomic classification and host subtraction analysis.

subtract_host.description: Subtract host (and any other classified) reads prior to analysis.

slurm_options.title: Slurm executor options
slurm_options.description: Options for executing this pipeline on a Slurm scheduler for an HPC cluster. The Slurm queue (or partition) must be specified in order to run the pipeline on Slurm cluster.

slurm_queue.description: Slurm queue or partition to run the pipeline on.
slurm_queue.help_text: This will be specific to the cluster you're using! Please check with the available queues with `$ sinfo` or check with your cluster admins to see which queue to use.

slurm_queue_size.description: Number of jobs Nextflow can queue simultaneously on the Slurm cluster.
slurm_queue_size.help_text: Please respect others using the cluster. The Slurm cluster is a likely a public resource so please specify a reasonable value.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

name.description: Custom name for pipeline execution. If not specified, then a random name will be generated by Nextflow.

container.description: Container to use for execution of pipeline.
container.help_text: This should not be changed unless you know what you're doing.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested    for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`
